definition[0]: an approximate number, amount, or time is close to the exact number, amount etc, but could be a little bit more or less than it
example[0]: What is the approximate number of students in each class?
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say rough rather than approximate:
example[2]: Can you give me a rough idea of how much it would cost?
definition[1]: to be close to a particular number
example[3]: This figure approximates to a quarter of the UKâ€™s annual consumption.
definition[2]: to be similar to but not exactly the same as something
example[4]: Your story only approximates to the real facts.
definition[3]: an approximate amount or number is not exact, but is more or less correct
example[5]: an approximate calculation of the overall cost of the project
